turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hello, my smart thermostat isn't working. The screen is completely blank. I've tried pressing the power button, but nothing happens.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! Thanks for contacting support. I understand your thermostat isn't displaying anything. Let's troubleshoot this. First, could you please check the circuit breaker that controls the thermostat? Sometimes, a tripped breaker can cause this issue.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I checked the breaker, and it wasn't tripped. I even flipped it off and on again, just in case. Still nothing. I'm starting to get really frustrated; it's freezing in here!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. Let's try a hard reset. Remove the thermostat from the wall. There should be a small reset button on the back; press it with a paperclip or similar object for about 10 seconds. After you put it back on the wall, see if it comes back on.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I tried that, and still no luck. The screen is still completely dead. Hmm, I have a question. Do you think a power surge could have damaged it even though it's behind a surge protector? I can't remember if we had one recently.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a possibility. While surge protectors offer protection, they're not always foolproof, and a strong enough surge could still potentially damage the thermostat. It's also possible there was a failure in the thermostat itself, unrelated to a surge. Unfortunately, based on the troubleshooting we've done, it seems like a hardware issue. To get a replacement, could you please provide the model number of your thermostat, as well as the date of purchase? We'll check your warranty coverage.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, sounds good. Thanks for your help! The model number is TH-2000, and I bought it on January 15th of last year.
